quote: Get going … walk if you have to, but finish the damned race.
author: Ron Hill

quote: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: If it doesn't challenge you, it won't change you.
author: Fred DeVito

quote: If you fail to prepare, you're prepared to fail.
author: Mark Spitz

quote: Persistence can change failure into extraordinary achievement.
author: Matt Biondi

quote: Make each day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

quote: You must expect great things from yourself before you can do them.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Running is about finding your inner peace, and so is life well lived.
author: Dean Karnazes

quote: Run when you can, walk if you have to, crawl if you must, just never give up.
author: Dean Karnazes

quote: I always tell my athletes, don’t confuse difficulty with failure.
author: Eric Orton

quote: We may train or peak for a certain race, but running is lifetime sport.
author: Alberto Salazar

quote: Man imposes his own limitations, don't set any.
author: Anthony Bailey

quote: Human beings are made up of flesh and blood, and a miracle fiber called courage.
author: George Patton

quote: Vision without action is a daydream.  Action without vision is a nightmare.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: The greatest pleasure in life, is doing the things people say we cannot do.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

quote: All it takes is all you got.
author: Marc Davis

quote: Run like hell and get the agony over with.
author: Clarence DeMar

quote: The only tactics I admire are do-or-die.
author: Herb Elliott

quote: It is true that speed kills. In distance running, it kills anyone who does not have it.
author: Brooks Johnson

quote: Other people may not have high expectations of me, but I have high expectations for myself.
author: Shannon Miller

quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: When you get to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: I had as many doubts as anyone else. Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
author: Alberto Salazar

quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Seneca

quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Do a little more each day than you think you possibly can.
author: Lowell Thomas

quote: Good judgement is the result of experience, experience is the result of bad judgment.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Once you're beat mentally, you might as well not even go to the starting line.
author: Todd Williams

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss it you will land among the star.
author: Les Brown

quote: If you want to make God laugh, just try and make plans for the future.
author: Ron Litzler

quote: The true test of a man's character is what he does when he knows he won't get caught.
author: Anonymous

quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
author: Pierre Cornielle

quote: The will to win means nothing without the will to prepare.
author: Juma Ikangaa

quote: Methinks that the moment my legs began to move, my thoughts began to flow.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: May the road rise up to meet you. May the wind be always at your back.
author: Irish Proverb

quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
author: Pierre Cornielle

quote: Ask yourself: 'Can I give more?'. The answer is usually: 'Yes'.
author: Paul Tergat

quote: The miracle isn't that I finished. The miracle is that I had the courage to start.
author: John Bingham

quote: Whether you believe you can or believe you can't, you're probably right
author: Henry Ford

quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: No one ever drowned in sweat.
author: Unknown

quote: There's no such thing as bad weather, just soft people.
author: Bill Bowerman

quote: If it hurts, make it hurt more.
author: Percy Cerutty

quote: Run often. Run long. But never outrun your joy of running.
author: Julie Isphording

quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Long slow distance makes long slow runners.
author: Jim Bush

quote: It's not about speed and gold medals. It's about refusing to be stopped.
author: Amby Burfoot

quote: I can't imagine living and not running.
author: Paula Radcliffe

quote: Any idiot can train himself into the ground; the trick is working in training to get gradually stronger.
author: Keith Brantly

quote: The best pace is a suicide pace, and today looks like a good day to die.
author: Steve Prefontaine

quote: The obsession with running is really an obsession with the potential for more and more life.
author: George A. Sheehan

quote: A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he begins to blame somebody else.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Have you ever felt worse after a run?
author: George A. Sheehan

quote: Every run is a great run!
author: Sasha Azevedo

quote: It doesn't matter whether you are a lion or a gazelle. When the sun comes up, you better be running.
author: Abe Gubegna

quote: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day-in and day-out.
author: Robert Collier

quote: It hurts up to a point and then it doesn't get any worse.
author: Ann Trason

quote: Run like hell and get the agony over with.
author: Clarence DeMar

quote: Somebody may beat me, but they are going to have to bleed to do it.
author: Steve Prefontaine

quote: Begin at the beginning and go on till you come to the end; then stop.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: It's better to burn out, than to fade away.
author: Neil Young

quote: Self trust is the essence of heroism.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Joy lies in the fight, in the attempt, in the suffering involved, not in the victory itself
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Everyone is an athlete. The only difference is that some of us are in training, and some are not.
author: George A. Sheehan

quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
author: Jules Renard

quote: I have met my hero, and he is me.
author: George A. Sheehan

quote: The only tactics I admire are do-or-die.
author: Herb Elliott
